m_szDocTitle: Student research | Office of the Dean for Graduate Education
m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- Stepner and Abrahams: Rich, poor have huge mortality gap in U.S. Poverty in the U.S. is often associated with deprivation, in areas including housing, employment, and education. Now a study co-authored by two MIT researchers has shown, in unprecedented geographic detail, another stark reality: Poor people live shorter lives, too. More precisely, the study shows that in the U.S., the richest 1 percent of men lives 14.6 years longer on average than the poorest 1 percent of men, while among women in those wealth percentiles, the difference is 10.1 years on average
